mta.ads.smid.model
Class NodeManager

java.lang.Object
  mta.ads.smid.model.NodeManager

 class NodeManager
extends java.lang.Object

Data Structure for managing k-tree nodes
the nodes are saved in an array and are issued by IDs (the id is the index of the node in the array)

Author:
Yossi Naor & Yosi Zilberberg

Nested Class Summary
(package private) static class NodeManager.Leaf
          Leaf element for managing k-tree leaf data structure.
(package private) static interface NodeManager.Node
          Node interface managing k-tree node data structure.
(package private) static class NodeManager.NonRoot
          NonRoot element for managing k-tree non root data structure.
(package private)  class NodeManager.Root
          Root element for managing a k-tree root data structure.

          available list IDs (indexes) of nodes in nodes array.

          node array. it's size is (n*7)/3+1;

Field Detail

nodes

private final NodeManager.Node[] nodes
node array. it's size is (n*7)/3+1;

availableNodes

private final int[] availableNodes
available list IDs (indexes) of nodes in nodes array.
unavailable value: NULL_ID = (-1)
available value: points to the next available position (index)

firstAvailableNode

private int firstAvailableNode
first available node (index) in the available list
NULL_ID = (-1) if none

rootIds

private final int[] rootIds
Cache root IDs (indexes) by name

k

private final int k
k-tree size

NULL_ID

private static final int NULL_ID
NULL_ID constant = -1

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

NodeManager

NodeManager(int k,
            int n)
NodeManager Constructor
implementation highlights:
  • store k as a member
  • manage a maximum number of (n*7)/3+1 nodes
  • create n leaves managed by n roots (each leave has it's own root)
  • initialize available
  • initialize available available nodes
    • initialize availableNodes[] array
    • initialize firstAvailableNode for the first available entry

Parameters:
k - the k-tree size
n - the number of elements to manage
Method Detail

getRoot

NodeManager.Root getRoot(int name)
return a matching Root element by a given name.
if there is no corresponding root matching that name return null.
at this point we assume that name is in range

Parameters:
name - requested Root name
Returns:
Root element

getLeaf

NodeManager.Leaf getLeaf(int name)
return a matching Leaf element by a given name.
at this point we assume that name is in range

Returns:
Leaf element

NodeManager.NonRoot getNonRoot(int id)
return a matching NonRoot element by a given id.
at this point we assume that id is in range

Returns:
NonRoot element

return a matching Node element by a given id.
at this point we assume that id is in range

Returns:
Node element

disposeRoot

void disposeRoot(int name)
Dispose a Root element by it's name
implementation highlights:
  • update available nodes
  • remove root from cached roots array

at this point we assume that id is in range

Parameters:
name - requested Root name to be disposed

createRoot

NodeManager.Root createRoot(int name,
                            int height,
                            NodeManager.Root rootChild1,
                            NodeManager.Root rootChild2)
Create a new Root element (for union case 2)
implementation highlights:
  • update available nodes
  • convert rootChild1 and rootChild2 into a NonRoot nodes and set them as children of the new root

Parameters:
name - the name of the new root
height - the height of the new root
rootChild1 - first root child to be converted into NonRoot child
rootChild2 - second root child to be converted into NonRoot child
Returns:
the created root

assign

private void assign(NodeManager.Node node,
                    int i)
Assign a new Node at index position i
implementation highlights:
  • update nodes[] array
  • update available nodes

Parameters:
node - the node to be assigned
i - index at the nodes[] array

addRootAsChild

private void addRootAsChild(NodeManager.Root childRoot,
                            NodeManager.Root parentRoot)
Add Root as Child (for union case 2)

Parameters:
childRoot - child root to be converted into NonRoot element
parentRoot - parent root for holding the child root

upLink

void upLink(int intoNodeId,
            NodeManager.Root from)
Link the sons of a root into a different node (can be a Root element or a NonRoot element)
implementation highlights:
  • all sons of the source root ('from') are linked into the new node id. son->parent link
  • the source root is disposed

Parameters:
intoNodeId - the destination node
from - the source root, that it's sons are transfered
